results.title: Mary Shelley's Frankenstein [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, American Zoetrope, Japan. National Tourist Organisation, Indieprod, Francis Ford Coppola, James V. Hart, John Veitch, David Parfitt and Kenneth Branagh
results.brief_description: At the dawn of the 19th Century, inspired by genius and driven by madness, Victor Frankenstein’s quest for immortality creates an unspeakable terror. Frankenstein is one of the most famous and chilling epic tales. The power and spirit of Mary Shelley’s profound Gothic legend is brought to life in this terrifying, passionate and haunting cinematic masterpiece. An electrifying, full-blooded love story starring Robert De Niro (Creature), Kenneth Branagh (Victor Frankenstein), Tom Hulce (Henry), Helena Bonham Carter (Elizabeth) and Aidan Quinn (Walton). Cast also includes John Cleese (Professor Waldman), Ian Holm (Victor’s father) and Richard Briers (Grandfather).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tri-Star Pictures, American Zoetrope, Japan. National Tourist Organisation, Indieprod, Francis Ford Coppola, James V. Hart, John Veitch, David Parfitt and Kenneth Branagh

results.title: Mary Poppins [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Walt Disney Productions and Robert Stevenson
results.brief_description: Based on the “Mary Poppins” books by P.L. Travers, this Walt Disney masterpiece stars Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, David Tomlinson and Glynis Johns. Disney successfully melds live action sequences with stop-animation, cell animation, song and dance routines. Set in 1910, the story is that of a stultified British family being run with cold efficiency by a draconian father, who pays no mind to his two children, Jane and Michael, and their suffragette mother. The children attempt to gain their parents’ attention by unsettling a slew of nannies, until Mary Poppins arrives to save them. Poppins has magical powers that enchant the children and she eventually brings the family back together, with the aid of her friend Bert (van Dyke). Charming songs include “Chim-Chim-Cher-Ee” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.” The film was nominated for thirteen Academy Awards, winning five including Best Picture. Screen debut of Julie Andrews, who won the Oscar for Best Actress.

results.title: Mary of Mile 18
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Svend-Erik Eriksen
results.brief_description: Beautifully animated film about a family living in an isolated part of Canada. Highlights aspects of remote rural life, such as long travelling periods in difficult weather conditions, the need for family members to be conscientious about various responsibilities around the farm and the closeness that can develop between members of a farming family. The story centres around a farm girl whose father will not allow her to keep a stray puppy until an event occurs that makes him reverse his decision. Based on a award-winning children’s book by Ann Blades.

results.title: Mary MacKillop: the beatification
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Susan Oliver and Max Donnellan
results.brief_description: Highlights of the beatification ceremony conducted by Pope John Paul II in Sydney on 19 January 1995. Mary MacKillop could become Australia’s first Saint. Born in Melbourne in 1842 she pioneered a religious order for women and dedicated her life to the poor, particularly children. Most of her work was in Penola, South Australia where she opened a school for children.

results.title: Mary Mackillop
results.creator_credit: Mark Callan, Film Australia, Pamela Vanneck and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
Mary McKillop was working as a tutor in 1861 when she decided to dedicate herself to the education of the poor, and devote herself to God. She became Sister Mary of the Cross of the Order of St Joseph, which was Australia’s first religious Order. Unlike other Orders, it placed itself outside the control of the local Bishop, which caused great feelings of resentment. Mary McKillop’s story is an extraordinary example of the power of the human spirit.

results.title: Mary Lewis -Student Nurse
results.brief_description: The story of a young girl’s three years’ training to becomes a States Registered Nurse in London. Follows the student’s life on and off duty, shows the comprehensive training received, and indicates the opportunities in various fields of nursing open to girls who qualify.
results.description: The story of a young girl’s three years’ training to becomes a States Registered Nurse in London. Follows the student’s life on and off duty, shows the comprehensive training received, and indicates the opportunities in various fields of nursing open to girls who qualify.

results.title: Mary Durack
results.brief_description: An interview with Australian writer, Mary Durack, and her sister, Elizabeth, recorded in December 1982 in Perth. Mary Durack had never, when growing up, entertained the idea of being a writer and began writing as “a bit of a game”. Her first efforts were published when she was ten. The Duracks lived on cattle stations in the Kimberleys in NW Western Australia. In the interview, Mary Durack recalls the life on the Argyle and Ivanhoe stations and her close relationship with the Aborigines living there as well as the influence her father has had on her books “Kings in Grass Castles” and its sequel. Produced in association with the Archival Film Program of the Australia Council.

results.title: Mary Bignal Rand
results.brief_description: Almost unknown in 1957, Mary Bignal, now Mrs. Rand, gained renown having won every international athletic track events. She was chosen Sportswoman of the Year in 1959, and is one of the finest all round athletes Britain has known. She manages to combine a fulltime job with the rigorous training of a champion and the everyday chores of a housewife.

results.title: Mary
results.brief_description: ‘Mary’ combines colour film from the early 1950s as well as modern 16mm footage. Scratched and painted upon, this experimental film links timeless images of the ocean with old footage of a young woman. The effect is both mysterious and moody creating an intangible, lingering feeling of melancholy.

results.title: Mary
results.creator_credit: Rosemary Blight, R B Films and Kay Pavlou
results.brief_description: Lucy Bell stars as Mary MacKillop in this dramatisation of her life. Born to Scottish migrant parents, Mary experienced a calling to the religious life when she was five. As a young woman she was troubled by the poverty and injustice of colonial Australia and established the Sisters of St. Joseph. Her work brought her into conflict with the Catholic hierachy and she was at one point excommunicated. Her faith and dedication never wavered and her Order continues to inspire to this day. Lucy Bell gives an excellent performance as Mary, providing an insight into the character of this amazing woman.
